meanings.definition: Bordered or edged with a distinct line.
meanings.sent1: The limbate frame of the painting made it stand out on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The limbate design on the vase added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent3: The limbate pattern on the rug looked like a fancy picture frame.
meanings.sent4: Her limbate hairstyle framed her face beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The limbate outline of the map highlighted the country borders clearly.

meanings.definition: Having a distinct border or edge.
meanings.sent1: The limbate leaves of the plant were easy to distinguish from the others.
meanings.sent2: The limbate pages of the book were golden and shiny.
meanings.sent3: The limbate edges of the cake slices made them look like mini masterpieces.
meanings.sent4: The limbate clouds in the sky resembled fluffy pillows.
meanings.sent5: The limbate outline of the building made it look like a majestic castle.
